name: AnthropicModel

input.content:
In freecad I want to have a circle but only for reference not to actually be a circle but just so I can line up other lines to make a hexagon for example.
How do I do that?

output:
In FreeCAD, you can create a reference circle that you can use to align other lines or shapes without the circle itself being part of the final geometry. Here's how you can do it:

1. Open FreeCAD and create a new sketch or open an existing one.

2. In the Sketcher workbench, click on the "Create circle" tool from the toolbar or go to Sketch > Sketcher geometries > Create circle.

3. Click in the sketch area to place the center point of the circle, and then click again to define the radius of the circle.

4. With the circle selected, look for the "Construction Mode" option in the Sketcher toolbar or in the Sketcher geometries menu. It is represented by a blue icon with a diagonal line. Click on it to toggle the construction mode for the circle.

   When you enable the construction mode, the circle will change its appearance, usually to a dashed or lighter color line. This indicates that the circle is now a reference geometry and will not be part of the final shape.

5. You can now use the reference circle to align other lines or shapes. For example, to create a hexagon:
   - Create six lines by clicking on the "Create line" tool and clicking on the circumference of the reference circle at equal intervals.
   - Use the "Create coincident constraint" tool to make sure each line starts and ends on the circumference of the reference circle.
   - Optionally, you can add additional constraints like equal length or parallel constraints to ensure the hexagon is regular.

6. Once you have created the hexagon or any other desired shape using the reference circle, you can exit the sketch.

The reference circle will not be part of the final geometry, but it will have served its purpose as a guide for aligning other elements in your sketch.

Remember to toggle off the construction mode for the lines that you want to be part of the final shape, as construction mode elements are not included in the final geometry when you exit the sketch.
